title: The Palisade (Colorado)
text:
The Palisade is a three-mile (4.8-km) long <a href="butte">butte</a> in <a href="Mesa%20County%2C%20Colorado">Mesa County, Colorado</a>, located slightly north of the town of <a href="Gateway%2C%20Colorado">Gateway</a>. Its elevation is .
It is the most prominent geologic feature in both the eponymously named The Palisade <a href="Area%20of%20Critical%20Environmental%20Concern">Area of Critical Environmental Concern</a> and The Palisade <a href="Wilderness%20Study%20Area">Wilderness Study Area</a>. The region is a diverse area spanning vertical <a href="cliff">cliff</a>s, <a href="mesa">mesa</a>s, deep rugged <a href="canyon">canyon</a>s and flat desert valley bottoms. The area is protected for <a href="peregrine%20falcon">peregrine falcon</a> and <a href="golden%20eagle">golden eagle</a> breeding areas as well as <a href="Gunnison%20sage-grouse">Gunnison sage-grouse</a> habitat. It is also managed for the preservation of sensitive plant species.
